unnormalised: The rooftop solar subsidy program is a welcome initiative, benefiting homeowners like Mr. Sharma in Delhi. However, increased transparency regarding disbursement timelines is crucial. Many applicants report delays exceeding 6 months post-approval (approval granted 26/01/2024), impacting project viability. Perhaps MNRE can publish average processing times? We are facing issues at our Bangalore branch. The Rs. 20,000 subsidy (application filed 15/10/2023, inspection done at 11:00 hrs on 01/12/2023) has still not been credited. Timely support is key for widespread adoption and aligns with India's 2030 goals.
normalised: The rooftop solar subsidy program is a welcome initiative, benefiting homeowners like Mister Sharma in Delhi. However, increased transparency regarding disbursement timelines is crucial. Many applicants report delays exceeding six months post-approval (approval granted twenty sixth January two thousand and twenty four), impacting project viability. Perhaps M N R E can publish average processing times? We are facing issues at our Bangalore branch. The rupee twenty thousand subsidy (application filed fifteenth October two thousand and twenty three, inspection done at eleven zero zero hours on first December two thousand and twenty three) has still not been credited. Timely support is key for widespread adoption and aligns with India's two thousand and thirty goals.
